alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 8:11AM PST until January 06 at 5:09PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 21.4 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.4 feet on 02/27/1957. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as necessary.
